snippet: Maj. Nidal Malik Hasan dismissed his Army lawyers and will conduct his own defense in the 2009 shooting that killed 13 people at Fort Hood, Tex.
abstract: Nidal Malik Hasan, Army psychiatrist accused of killing 13 people in 2009 shooting rampage at Fort Hood, Tex, plans to represent himself when his trial begins; military law experts say Hasan is likely to use trial as stage to promote his radical Islamic beliefs.
lead_paragraph: Maj. Nidal Malik Hasan dismissed his Army lawyers and will conduct his own defense in the 2009 shooting that killed 13 people at Fort Hood, Tex.

headline.seo: Fort Hood Shooting Suspect Allowed to Represent Himself
headline.main: Judge Says Ft. Hood Shooting Suspect May Act as His Own Lawyer in Court
headline.print_headline: Judge Says Ft. Hood Shooting Suspect May Act as His Own Lawyer in Court
